Reviews.Title: More camera for the same money!
Reviews.Author: WMU Officer
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I have a very simple Zmodo 8 channel home security dvr and I noticed that the cameras that came with it really sucked.  That was about 2 years ago and ever since I have been on the hunt for better cameras for my dvr.The first camera I ordered was the 600 tvl Videosecu Dome Camera (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003YZXQXG/ref=oh_details_o02_s00_i00).  When the camera arrived I was so excited that I did not even realize that I had actually received was an AVUE AV666s (http://www.amazon.com/AVUE-AV666S-Varifocal-distance-adjustment/dp/B00564VGK8/ref=cm_cr_pr_pb_t).  I was amazed by the variable zoom and variable focus on the camera that I did not even care that it was the wrong color and not the actual product that I had ordered.  Plus the image quality far surpassed that of the current Zmodo comers that I had.  So without any questions I installed it and have been happily using it ever since.So, I finally saved up enough money to get a second camera and not remembering that Amazon had sent me the wrong camera the first time I reordered the 600 tvl Videosecu Dome Camera.  Needless to say Amazon did not screw up twice and I was significantly disappointed when I actually received what I had ordered.  I should point out that the Videosecu camera is about 2/3 the size of this Evertech Camera, but believe me when I say the features on this Evertech more then make up for the size difference.  So, what led me to send the Videosecu Camera back was the night vision view.  I installed the Videosecu and eventually the Evertech Cameras on the overhang of my roof next to my garage.  The camera is pointed almost horizontally to capture the concrete apron in front of my garage, the driveway and most of my front yard.  Unfortunately when I positioned the Videosecu Camera roughly 5 degrees down from straight horizontal I realized that the LEDs for the "night vision" where actually reflecting into the camera lens and washing out most of the picture.  Well that made the camera utterly useless.  So I returned the Videosecu and started looking for a similar camera to the AVUE AV666s.Enter the EVERTECH 700 TVL Camera!!!  Stat wise this camera dwarfed both the Videosecu and the AVUE AV666s cameras.  With 700 TVL instead of 600 TVL I get better resolution (although I should note that my sub par Zmodo DVR only records up to 420 TVL resolution), with 36 LEDs I get 16 more LEDs for better night vision then the Videosecu camera and with a 2.8-12mm zoom lens I get the best of both wide angle and zoom lens capabilities in one camera.Okay, so lets break down some of the features.The 700 TVL.  Again this is far superior resolution then I got with the original 380 TVL Zmodo Cameras.  I mean it is night and day difference even in the daytime, and at nighttime I can actually see what is in front of the camera where as with the Zmodo cameras I could just make out movement but not actually know what was moving.  Compared to the 600 TVL resolution of the AVUE camera I can just slightly tell a difference when looking at the live feeds.  Again, however, when looking at the recorded video it is the same since my Zmodo DVR limits the recording resolution on both cameras to 420 TVL.The 36 LEDs.  These can be both a positive and a negative.  If you are going to use this camera for relatively close quarters or small, enclosed spaces I have to say I think your nighttime images could be washed out due to overpowering LEDs.  However, if you're going to use this camera for outside recording like I do the extra LEDs really help illuminate almost the entire recorded image even at the widest setting of 2.8mm.  Again at the 2.8mm setting on the camera the LEDs reach past 50 feet with ease but start to fade in intensity beyond 75 feet.The 2.8-12mm Vari-focal lens.  This is probably the second best feature behind the resolution (700 TVL).  If you have any question in your mind how close or how far away your camera needs to be from what you want to record, or how much of a particular area you want to record you should definitely get this camera.  The 2.8-12mm lens means you can zoom out to one of the widest lens settings that security cameras come in, 2.8mm.  With the camera set to 2.8mm I can view approximately 50 feet from one side of the image to the other at a distance of only 15 feet from the camera (hope that makes sense).  So at 2.8mm I can see almost an entire semi-truck trailer (not including the cab) with the trailer placed only 15 feet in front of the camera.  But if I zoom the lens in all the way to 12 mm I can see approximately 20 feet from one side of the camera image to the other, or about the length of a pickup truck.  That's a lot of zoom from one lens and makes this camera very versatile and for picky people like me allows you to be able to capture exactly what you want with this camera!  The other aspect of this lens is the Vari-focal.  That means that as you zoom the lens in and out you can also refocus the lens.  Needless to say that is mandatory because the image is completely unrecognizable if you left the focus at the correct focus point for the 2.8mm setting and then zoomed in even to the 5mm lens setting.  The point I'm trying to make is that you are able to focus the camera on what ever you want and you are not out of luck of the manufacturer's focus setting gives you a slightly unfocused image.The exterior of the camera is almost identical to the picture; the only downside was that my camera came with the logo MGI screen-printed on the front of the base. Yes, I did order the camera from MGI as it was the cheapest seller of the camera, but I did not expect them to put their logo on a camera they did not manufacture.  More of a minus to the seller though then the camera itself.  The other interesting thing that was not in the description of the camera was the small five-way controller that is physically built into the camera's cable.  I still have not fully figured out what all the small remote can control, but after one minute I was able to find controls for the camera itself that allowed me to mirror the image, adjust the color contrast, brightness, sharpness and, if memory serves me correctly, the white balance of the camera.  All very sophisticated controls that I was not expecting, but was pleasantly surprised by, especially since the camera was only $69.43, read cheaper then both the Videosecu and AVUE cameras!All in all, I could not be happier with the camera and not only would I recommend it to anyone looking for this type of camera, but I am going to be purchasing two more as soon as funds allow, as I do not think there is a better camera out there for the money.  Hope this wasn't too long and helps some of you on the fence about this product.  If you have any questions please ask and I will try to answer them promptly.

Reviews.Title: Great Wide Angle Camera
Reviews.Author: jrod
Reviews.Content: I have tried and looked for wide angle cameras on Amazon and this is the best camera for the money, hands down! The other cameras that I have tried just didn't have the wide angle even though they stated they were. In my situation I have used the cameras that were bundled with my DVR but I was disappointed with the overall view, for instance I wanted to get the view of the front and rear yards. Most bundled cameras can only cover 1/4 to 1/2 of 25 foot wide yard, meaning that I would need at least two of these regular cameras to cover these areas. I was impressed that with this camera I was able to see the entire yard with only one camera, I haven't even tried adjusting the zoom and focus because the factory settings worked great. With the help of the Metal Halide yard light this camera displays in full color even at night. The one that I installed for the front yard has a great picture too, it covers the entire 25 foot yard and sidewalk/street area. It too is in color but less so because the only lights in front are the street lights. With my other cameras when it got dark outside I basically lost the picture because of the low lighting, the night vision on these cameras give a great picture, I even get a good picture before the street lights kick in.The only two cons was the mounting system and the different models that I received.I ordered one camera on 9/11/12 and it was fulfilled by CCTVONE and I received the model listed on this page (EV-CDM368IRV), the 2nd one I ordered on 11/25/12 was fulfilled by Evertech-USA and I received Model # EV-CDM368IR V.7. The main difference is that the EV-CDM368IR V.7 has the the on screen display (OSD) so that you can make many adjustments to the camera such as back lighting, and picture adjustments (Brightness, Contrast, etc.) which works great. So if you want this feature then choose Evertech as the seller when order and hopefully you will get the EV-CDM368IR V.7 model. this model is also easier to mount because after you install the base to the wall it has a large outer ring that screws onto the base which is much easier. With the other camera model the outer ring is attached to the base with 3 small allen screws which can be a pain when you are trying to hold the camera and tighten the screws.Overall this is a great camera and I highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: Ridiculous mounting design
Reviews.Author: Ohio Guy
Reviews.Content: Does this camera work?  I'll never know as I never even mounted it.  Rather than use mounting screws to hold the parts together for easy disassembly and assembly, this one squeezes the camera ball into the holder.  At least that is what I eventually figured out on my own as it came without any instructions for mounting and the website is only for sale with no customer support.  They must use a hydraulic press to get the camera ball into the socket and then after sitting in the warehouse the ball fuses to the rubbing strips inside making it impossible to rotate, let alone push out of the socket.  Eventually I was able to force it out after a WD40 bath and holding my breath as I levered it out using my largest screwdriver against the ball camera (hoping all the while I wasn't going to break it), getting it back in would be difficult at best and then it's mounted FOREVER.  Yes, FOREVER.  There's no way to get that ball out again without access to the back side and you can't get to the back side while it's mounted!  What a STUPID design.  I'm just not going to do that so I'm returning it.

Reviews.Title: They're working well
Reviews.Author: AllAboutThisProduct
Reviews.Content: You may have noticed that a lot of vandal dome style cameras look the same, that's because for the most part some of them are the same.  I have taken a few like models that were branded differently apart to find that the boards and ID numbers matched in several instances even when having paid up to $30 in price difference, this means they were made by one manufacturer and massively branded.  Which one should you buy when there are so many that look the same?  Read all product descriptions carefully and note what is included as well as what is not included.  Make sure that the product title details closely match the product description and bullet points (features).  Pay close attention to the rated TVL (TV Lines), the higher the better, don't forget about the number of IR Led's as they will make or break your night vision experience.  Take your time when looking to purchase cameras, add dozens of similar models to your cart and compare pricing and features to get the most for your money.  This model seems to work well so far, if I have a problem I will definitely update my review.  A tip to the seller to pass on to the manufacturer(s): Add a small bit of teflon lubricant to the outer ring so that it isn't so difficult to remove the outer ring for installation.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Phouvieng
Reviews.Content: 3 stars:2.8 len gives you a wider viewing angleMetal casing makes it tougherPlugs fit in with a 5/8 drill hole.Easy to mount if you have half a brain.Low price-2 stars:Grainy picture on live feed not as good compare to a quality 600TVL camera*Blue infrared sensor reflection in video. This might be due to where I mounted on top of my porch roof.Waste of time now that I thought about it.I will be upgrading to HD cameras soon but this one might still serve a purpose until I can find a better replacement.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money..
Reviews.Author: Brian Lynch
Reviews.Content: We install a lot of cameras. Found these at half the price I usually pay. They worked pretty good. Has good color and the night vision is decent. Nice rugged construction and the threads were not all gunked up with paint like some of the other ones we have used in the past. I also like that it does not have a OSD Button, after awhile those are just a pain to deal with and is a point of failure right at the connection to the button.Recommend for sure.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, easy install, excellent IR illumination
Reviews.Author: Griz44Mag "Griz44Mag"
Reviews.Content: This one works as described.  The IR array is bright out to the end of my driveway.  The zoom will get you in and out to concentrate on the area you want to watch.  I had a hard time getting the system in focus until I loaded the remote software onto a tablet so I could stand on the ladder and adjust the focus while watching the camera output.  The white color blends well with the white house, you don't even notice the camera perched above the driveway at 18' off the pavement.  Who ever looks up anyway?  It's a decent price for a camera with these features.

Reviews.Title: Way better than my old ones.
Reviews.Author: JustMyExperience
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Zmodo 8 ch DVR/camera kit awhile back. The cameras that came with it were terrible to say the least. I wanted to see what else I could get. I purchased one of these to see how it compared. I figured out that I wanted something 700TVL, Dome, White, Wide-Angle, Day/Night. Looking at prices/reviews it didn't take long for me to find this one.-This has the best resolution you can get without going to IP cameras (which my system isn't set up for).-The camera itself was easy to install.-The difference in image quality (both day and night) between these and the 480tvl bullet cams I had, is amazing. Color and resolution. From across the room, looking at the monitor for my DVR, you can tell which channel the new camera is on.-It's white and a dome, it blends into my soffit much better than the black bullet cams that came with my kit.-No problems so far with any of them, they all worked right out of the box.-Wish it came with a power supply plug, seems these are usually sold separate though.Basically, this was a major upgrade from what I had and I will buy enough for the rest of my DVR channels in the near future, as budget allows.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Ruso Minnifield "PrinceHappy2"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good.  You can focus it plus the night viewing is great.  It has 700 TVL and looks good.  Remember, it is always better to buy the 700 Lines of resolutions over the 420 TVL.  It's worth the few extra dollars you spend VS the quality of picture you get.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: mary elisabeth kline
Reviews.Content: This camera looks great on a good coax cable with a proper termination.  I can't believe how wide the picture is on my T.V. and the clarity at night pn my phone.  This camera allows you to zoom and focus manually, but it also comes with a built in software program to adjust gain, sharpness, and ect.  I upgraded the cameras on my Zmodo system and will definitely buy more when I have the money.  This camera is not cheap a camera at all, because it is enclosed with a solid metal enclosure.  I bought this camera a year ago and it is working great!

Reviews.Title: I won't be buying another of these.
Reviews.Author: D. Darby
Reviews.Content: "It provide you with the clear high resolution image" is simply not true. Also there is NO disassemble or mounting instructions - I scratched it up simply trying to disassemble the ball/ring for mounting, so much so I didn't think I could return it.The outside (larger) base is 4.75" diameter.  It has 4 mounting screw holes, each opposite pair is 3.75" apart.  This base holds (pressure inserted - NOT THREADS) a free-wheeling inner base that holds the camera ball.  With much difficulty the camera ball can be rotated such that it eventually pops out of the inner base.A sticker has the words:Model: EV-CDM368 V.7-WLens: 2.8-12mmSystem: NTSCPower: DC 12V/450mAIt was a real pain to pop up the camera ball so I could mount it.  For others reviews I imagine that the white paint had 'melded' between the ball and the inner base.  I KNOW the black rubber spacers melded because when I first tried to manipulate the object the outer base and the ball moved as one.  I gently pried the rubber from the ball and then it became to move.  I suspect over time (outside) the paint and/or rubber will meld again making it rather difficult to adjust.Compared to my existing Defender camera (http://www.amazon.com/review/RDIH1ENE8UL5N/ref=cm_cr_pr_perm?ie=UTF8&ASIN;=B007ULV8I0&linkCode;=&nodeID;=&tag;=) this camera's colors are  'yellow' (there is no in-cable or camera adjustments) - I wish I could attach a .jpg to show you the contrast.For me the only advantage is the depth of field and focus, but it doesn't seem worth it for the difficulty in mounting and adjustment.  I will not be buying one of these again.Edit:  Figured out how to add a pic.  Mine is the one with 4 camera images.  Bottom Left is this camera.

Reviews.Title: Didn't live up to expectations.
Reviews.Author: RONNIERAYSR
Reviews.Content: With the specifications on this camera, I would expect more.  If you are putting the camera in a room with outside light coming in, forget it!.  I really can't recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: great Product
Reviews.Author: Review Master
Reviews.Content: Great product works as discribed. Only one problem does not work well in the dark. I live in mountains with no street lights and camera is pitch black but over all it works well. Seller evertech is what made this 5 stars. Great seller went out of his way to get me missing part. Honest and fast service. Will buy again.

Reviews.Title: I guess you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: KJAG
Reviews.Content: The mounting base was locked on to the camera and refused to come off.  Furthermore, no adequate instruction manual was provided. The single page UserManual is largely copied specs and otherwise a few basics.  Nothing on removing the base, positioning or adjusting the lens, mounting, etc.  The skimpy info provided is obviously foreign-written and largely gibbrish. Example: The power supply must through safe attestation. ???The lens was smudged and without even a very simple piece of plastic to cover the lens while handling the camera (as I've received on other bullitt cameras I've purchased, e.g., Lorex).  Keep in mind also there is no additional cable provided, only the short cable attached to the camera.No warranty came with the product, and it was contained in generic packaging, with no markings on anything that indicated the manufacturer, e.g., Evertech or the model.  My personal opinion this may be a knock-off, probably made in China. For this product, you may want to pay a little more and go with a source you know is reputable. The source I used promises a free gift if you rate them a 5 star, so don't make decision just based on positive rating.  You can tell by reading some of their short, non-descriptive 5-star reviews that some customers bought into their strategy.If and when I get it up and running, I'll provide more feedback.

Reviews.Title: Works at night but not as well as I had hoped
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Replaced a similar one that did not have good night capability and while it was a small improvement, I am still looking for a better low light camera to replace two others with.  If you don't need good night light, don't waste the money on these as the $39.00 camera's I had will do the job.I'm beginning to think that they don't build a great night camera for under $300

Reviews.Title: Evertech EV-CDM368IRV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Ordered two of them one month apart, but from Evertech. First one was what I ordered and is working great and I really liked the camera, so I bought the second one. Ordered the same camera from the same company, but I do not know what I received. It is the not the same camera that I received the first time. It looks similiar, but the second one does not have the OSD feature. Not sure what the disconnect is with Evertech. Was going to buy more, but I will have to find another vendor that I can trust that I will get what I ordered.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Orlando Pagan
Reviews.Content: Best day/night camera I ever bought. 700TVL makes a hugh difference. Installation was as good as it can be. Bought a second one.

Reviews.Title: 700 TVL dome camera
Reviews.Author: Frankm5
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this brief as WMU officer covered a lot of points.  Its a good camera for the money night vision is good and the IR's light up a good distance of the image. Day time image is good as well and colours are good.Just be aware you'll need 5.5 inches of flat area to mount the base and if your using inside on wall board go to the hardware store and get some decent wall anchors as the ones supplied are marginal.Really can't find any thing bad about product but vendor really was lazy about packing this item as they just covered camera box in paper and tape to ship rather than put in a shipping box with some extra padding.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money!!!
Reviews.Author: JZ
Reviews.Content: I replaced one of my 420TVL cameras with this 700TVL camera to see how much of a difference there is. So far, I like it! But for a better quality picture, you need to make sure you cables and DVR are capable for a high resolution picture! With the basic cables still hooked up, I can see a big difference! Espically on the night vision! I switched from the RCA hook-ups to the VGA hook-ups for a better picture, but I ordered cheap cables instead of high resolution cables, so my new cables will be in shortly to see how much clearer of a picture I can get out of this camera compaired to my other ones!  Installation wasn't hard at all! I haven't played with the zoom or focus yet, it's pretty good how its set up for where I have this one. Plus, theres no cables hanging wich makes me happier!  This camera isn't small at all! the round part is almost the size of a soft ball! So if your trying to be descrete, this camera isn't it for you!  Hope this helps you out, I do plan on getting a few more of these, after I'm done playing with the cables to get the best quality picture possible out of this one compaired to the old ones which is the only reason why i gave it 4 out of 5 stars for the time being for now. I will update this later if the results are noticable.

Reviews.Title: Cheap camera. Went blurry after 3 months
Reviews.Author: quality control
Reviews.Content: It worked fine with ok results. After 3 months the day picture went blurry. I replaced with monoprice cam and its working fine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, with a very wide angle - gets all four corners of a huge living room. As long as you get the proper wiring & drives, the picture quality is great too. Excellent product for the price. And it is more discrete than I thought. I was worried it would look weird staring at people as they walk in the living room. But it's not. Very tastefully discrete, but not too discrete, if that helps anyone!

Reviews.Title: Evertech EV-CDM368IRV is great ONLY if you don't have to mount it.
Reviews.Author: D. Craine
Reviews.Content: I thought that the negative reviews about the mounting of this camera was an exaggeration. I ordered this Evertech EV-CDM368IRV CCTV Security Camera(White) anyway thinking that it can't be that bad. BOY WAS I WRONG! The are no disassembly instructions, mounting instructions, and a very poor info sheet. I was afraid I was going to damage it trying to get it apart so that I could mount it. The construction of this camera is a JOKE. The picture is ok but the mounting of it is almost impossible. And once you get it mounted, it will be even harder to get back apart if you want to un mount it.

Reviews.Title: Believe Evertech is scamming on this camera.
Reviews.Author: Hometradesman
Reviews.Content: Ordered this camera EV-CDM368IRV as a pair from Evertech.  Both arrived without any mounting instructions.  Neither even came with a legit spec sheet, just a zeroxed (badly I add) copy of some generic homemade specs.I was instantly concerned but continued testing the equipment.  When plugged into system, the picture was subpar for a supposed 700TVL camera.  It matched up quite closely to my existing Defender 600TVL cameras.  After sorting through the shipping container I think I found out why.Evertech sent a sales brochure with a list of all of their equipment that they offer.  Inside this brochure is the exact same model camera but it is listed as a 600TVL!  Really!?!So, my conclusion is that the cameras are actually only 600TVL but due to the lack of physical specs on the actual equipment and the homemade spec sheet inserted in the boxes, Evertech is scamming consumers by charging extra for what we think is a 700TVL camera.Now, on the 600TVL level camera, this didnt seem that bad, besides the actual dome being stuck to the base to the point that you cant adjust it... at.. all!  You will sooner aggrevate your carpel tunnel than get these things off the base to even mount them.  Good design, Bad assembly practices.Just thought it was in the best interest of consumers to know my experience.  Buyer Beware.

Reviews.Title: Security system
Reviews.Author: frenchie
Reviews.Content: This was bought to add camera to the security system in our building. The price was great,lot cheaper that the installation man was asking for
